Reason: The configuration _journalSizeThreshold is performance-sensitive. The reason for this classification is that the _journalSizeThreshold directly affects the creation of a PersistentJournal object, which involves performance-related operations such as disk I/O and memory allocation. The value of _journalSizeThreshold can significantly impact the size of the journal and the frequency of disk sync operations, leading to notable performance variations at the system level. Therefore, this configuration is considered performance-sensitive based on its impact on system performance and the performance-related operations within its related code.
